building_details.building_ref: No new buildings or change in height

description: Installation of extraction/flue to rear elevation
decision_conditions: <p dir="ltr" style="line-height:1.2;background-color:#ffffff;margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:0pt;"><span style="font-size:11pt;font-family:Arial;color:#222222;background-color:transparent;font-weight:400;font-style:normal;font-variant:normal;text-decoration:none;vertical-align:baseline;white-space:pre;white-space:pre-wrap;">Noise emitted by all building services plant including from atmospheric vents shall be -10dBA below the existing measured lowest LA90(10min) background noise level at any time when all plants are in use, where the plant noise source is tonal it shall be - 15dBA. The noise emitted shall be measured or predicted at 1.0m from the facade of the nearest residential window or at 1.2m above any adjacent residential garden, terrace, balcony or patio. The equipment shall be serviced regularly in accordance with manufacturers instructions and as necessary to ensure that the requirements of the condition are maintained. If at any time the plant is unable to comply with this. Condition, it shall be switched off and not used again until it is able to comply.</span></p><p><span id="docs-internal-guid-dcef33e9-7fff-c88b-1c82-6795e54ae886"></span></p><p dir="ltr" style="line-height:1.728;margin-left: 1pt;background-color:#ffffff;margin-top:18pt;margin-bottom:0pt;"><span style="font-size:11pt;font-family:Arial;color:#222222;background-color:transparent;font-weight:400;font-style:normal;font-variant:normal;text-decoration:none;vertical-align:baseline;white-space:pre;white-space:pre-wrap;">Reason: To protect the amenities of residential occupiers.</span></p>

<p dir="ltr" style="line-height:1.2;margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:0pt;"><span style="font-size:11pt;font-family:Arial;color:#000000;background-color:transparent;font-weight:400;font-style:normal;font-variant:normal;text-decoration:none;vertical-align:baseline;white-space:pre;white-space:pre-wrap;">Within 1 month of the date of this decision, details shall be submitted to and approved in writing by the local planning authority, of a suitable cleaning schedule and/or maintenance contract for the extract and odour control system. Approved details shall be implemented prior to occupation of the development and thereafter be permanently retained.&nbsp;</span></p><p><span id="docs-internal-guid-e1601ec9-7fff-02db-81e9-7d46b8e04302"><br></span></p><p dir="ltr" style="line-height:1.2;margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:0pt;"><span style="font-size:11pt;font-family:Arial;color:#000000;background-color:transparent;font-weight:400;font-style:normal;font-variant:normal;text-decoration:none;vertical-align:baseline;white-space:pre;white-space:pre-wrap;">Reason: To ensure that the amenity of occupiers of the development site/ surrounding premises is not adversely affected by smell, odours and other effluents.</span></p>

<p>The following works shall be undertaken within 4 months of the date of this permission
[unless, in the case of a) below, that a sooner date is mandated by an effective enforcement
notice] and any debris arising from those works removed from the site:
</p><p>a) Removal of the unauthorised flu at the rear of the property; and
</p><p>b) installation of the flu hereby approved.
</p><p>REASON: To ensure that the unauthorised development is removed and the flu hereby
approved, is installed within an appropriate timeframe in the interests of safeguarding
residential amenity.<br></p>

<p><span id="docs-internal-guid-535866c1-7fff-6ec5-af5d-fb717c8acb9e"></span></p><p dir="ltr" style="line-height:1.2;margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:0pt;"><span style="font-size:11pt;font-family:Arial;color:#000000;background-color:transparent;font-weight:400;font-style:normal;font-variant:normal;text-decoration:none;vertical-align:baseline;white-space:pre;white-space:pre-wrap;">Prior to the commencement of development, details of anti-vibration measures shall be submitted to and approved in writing by the local planning authority. The measures shall ensure that all plant/extract/ventilation systems and ducting are mounted with proprietary anti-vibration isolators and fan motors are vibration isolated from the casing and adequately silenced. Approved details shall be implemented prior to occupation of the development and thereafter be permanently retained. </span></p><p dir="ltr" style="line-height:1.2;margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:0pt;"><span style="font-size:11pt;font-family:Arial;color:#000000;background-color:transparent;font-weight:400;font-style:normal;font-variant:normal;text-decoration:none;vertical-align:baseline;white-space:pre;white-space:pre-wrap;"><br></span></p><p dir="ltr" style="line-height:1.2;margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:0pt;"><span style="font-size:11pt;font-family:Arial;color:#000000;background-color:transparent;font-weight:400;font-style:normal;font-variant:normal;text-decoration:none;vertical-align:baseline;white-space:pre;white-space:pre-wrap;">Reason: To ensure that the amenity of occupiers of the development site/ surrounding premises is not adversely affected by vibration.</span></p>

The development hereby permitted must be begun not later than the expiration of three years beginning with the date of this permission.


REASON: In order to comply with the provisions of the Town and Country Planning Act 1990 (as amended).
